title: Commission Regulation (EEC) No 2333/83 of 11 August 1983 on the classification of goods falling within heading No 15.06 of the Common Customs Tariff
header:
COMMISSION  REGULATION (EEC) No 2333/83
of 11 August 1983
on the classification of goods falling within heading No 15.06 of the Common Customs Tariff
THE COMMISSION OF THE EUROPEAN
COMMUNITIES
main_body:
The product consisting of partly hydrolyzed pig fat, obtained as a by-product in the manufacture of gelatin from pigskin by the action of strong acids, with a free fatty acid content (calculated as oleic acid) of 10 % or more, and a peroxide index of about 5 or more, shall be classified in the Common Customs Tariff under heading No:
15.06 Other animal oils and fats (including neat's- foot oil and fats from bones or waste).

This Regulation shall enter into force on the 21st day following its publication in the Official Journal of the European Communities.
This Regulation shall be binding in its entirety and directly applicable in all Member States.
attachments:
Done at Brussels, 11 August 1983.
For the Commission
Ătienne DAVIGNON
Vice-President
